meanings.definition: Grow or cause to grow and become more mature, advanced, or elaborate.
meanings.sent1: Children develop quickly during their first few years.
meanings.sent2: The seeds will develop into beautiful flowers with proper care.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if my pet rock will develop superpowers one day.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for painting began to develop like a blooming flower.
meanings.sent5: The small acorn will develop into a mighty oak tree over time.

meanings.sent1: Please develop your ideas further in the next paragraph.
meanings.sent2: The author will develop the plot twists in the upcoming chapters.
meanings.sent3: I can't wait to see how you develop your Lego masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: Her story began to develop like a complex puzzle coming together.
meanings.sent5: The plan started to develop into a detailed blueprint for success.

meanings.definition: Bring out the capabilities or possibilities of.
meanings.sent1: The coach aims to develop the team's full potential this season.
meanings.sent2: Music lessons can help develop a child's musical talents.
meanings.sent3: I tried to develop my hidden talent for juggling, but it didn't go well.
meanings.sent4: Her encouragement helped develop his confidence like a protective shield.
meanings.sent5: The workshop will help develop your skills like a master craftsman.
